result.execSummary:
The defendant Marquis Dontrell Wilder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Attempt Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: If revoked, release for work if employed at time of revocation.  May participate in vocational training.

miscConds.notes:
Hearing 9/3/2015.                          -
09-03-15/ Stephanie Rothstein              -
Court ordered restitution in the amount of $2,304.00, to be paid to James B.  Defendant to enter into a payment plan with the DOC and is TO PAY NO LESS THAN $60.00 PER MONTH TOWARDS RESTITUTION.  Court ordered restitution to be Joint & Several with 15CF365.  If revoked, restitution is to be paid through collection by the DOC from 25% of funds.   Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges and DNA surcharge  during period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Maintain full time employment of at least 30 hours per week.  Obtain HSED/GED.

No contact with James B. or his family, residence, or place of business.
No contact with coactor Casey Holmes.

timeConds.notes: Straight time, forthwith.  Credit for seven (7) days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marquis Dontrell Wilder

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Reflects 09-03-15 Court order for restitution $2,304.00, J&S, restitution.

Defendant Marquis Dontrell Wilder in court with attorney Sergio Magana.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for restitution hearing. Parties have reached a stipulation. Court ordered restitution in the amount of $2,304.00 to be paid to James B. Defendant to enter into a payment plan with the DOC and is to pay no less than $60.00 per month towards restitution. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court ordered restitution to be joint and several with 15CF365. If revoked, restitution be paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds.
Restitution packet received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.

Defendant Marquis Dontrell Wilder in court with attorney Sergio Magana.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Plea hearing proceeds.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.  Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  State's request for adjournment was granted by the Court.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55-A of the Criminal Justice Facility.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 25 on 8/03/15 at 1:30 p.m.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Marquis Dontrell Wilder in court,   Attorney Sergio Magana appears telephonically.  
Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Sentencing Hearing.  Defense attorney out ill; request for adjournment granted by the court.  Adjourned date selected with the parties.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Report, filed.

Defendant Marquis Dontrell Wilder in court with attorney Sergio Magana.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of Sara Schroeder for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date.  Court granted defense request and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report received and filed.

Defendant Marquis Dontrell Wilder in court with attorney Sergio Magana.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp for Sara Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel newly appointed.  Defense counsel needs discovery.  All conditions of bail remain the same.    Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial report, received and filed.

Defendant Marquis Dontrell Wilder in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw (due to a conflict with the Public Defender's Office)  granted by the Court.  Court ordered Public Defender's Office to have new counsel appointed.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Status conference scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Justice Point Pretrial Report, filed.

Defendant Marquis Dontrell Wilder in court.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Another attorney set this date for Attorney Morales who was unavailable on today's date.  Mutually agreeable date selected off the record.  Court granted request for adjournment and ordered all terms and conditions of bail are to continue. File retained in court.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marquis Dontrell Wilder in court with attorney Mark Dluzak for Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Deann Heard for Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 4/8/15.
css
Justice Point Pretrial Report received and filed.

Defendant Marquis Dontrell Wilder in court.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised the Court that he is now unemployed.  Court ordered defendant to go to the Public Defender's Office immediately after court today to be re-interviewed.  Court admonished defendant for positive drug test and warned that further use may result in a change of bail.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue and ordered case adjourned for preliminary hearing before Branch PE on 4/09/15 at 1:30 p.m.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Airsoft Jungle Club; Jeremy A. or James B.

Defendant Marquis Dontrell Wilder in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Marquis Dontrell Wilder in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Indigency hearing scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
